title: Today’s entertainment picks:
text:
Published: Sat, October 24, 2015 @ 12:00 a.m. 
Today’s entertainment picks: 
v The Beach Boys, 8 p.m.: The boys of eternal summer surf into Packard Music Hall, 1703 Mahoning Ave. NW, Warren; ticketmaster. 
v Phantoms hockey, 7:05 p.m.: The local team takes on the Muskegon Lumberjacks at Covelli Centre; youngstownphantoms.com. 
v Youngstown Zombie Crawl, 11 a.m. to 2 a.m.: A family-friendly affair at the B&O Station, 530 Mahoning Ave., that culminates in a zombie march to downtown at 6:15. 
v “Zombeo and Juliet” and “Downton Zombie,” 7:30 p.m.: A pair of one-act spoofs on stage at Victorian Players Theater, 702 Mahoning Ave., Youngstown, just a few blocks from the Zombie Crawl; 330-746-5455. 
v Oakhill Cemetery Walking Tours, 1:30 p.m. and 3 p.m.: Free tours of this historic burial ground, just a few blocks from the Zombie Crawl, sponsored by Mahoning Valley Historical Society. 
“Da Vinci’s Demons” (8 p.m., Starz): When the third and final season of “Da Vinci’s Demons” begins, Leonardo da Vinci’s (Tom Riley) world is about to come crashing down as the city of Otranto is brutalized by an Ottoman invasion. Even worse, the enemy is using weapons inspired by Leo’s own secret blueprints. 
For complete listings, see TV Week magazine, included with today’s paper. 
LOCAL TOPICS ON TV 
“Community Connection” (Sunday at 6:30 a.m. on 21 WFMJ-TV and 11 a.m. on WBCB-TV): Charlene Allen and Elaine Maro from Access Health Mahoning Valley will join host Madonna Chism Pinkard to discuss health care options for low-income, uninsured adults and access to needed medical care. 
Next, Danette Palmer, Homes for Kids, and Maria Meadors of the Ray “Boom Boom” Mancini Foundation will discuss the Hall of Fame Night at the Hollywood racino in Austintown, a fundraiser for Homes for Kids and foster children in the Valley. 
“Increase the Peace” (today at 6:30 p.m. and Sunday at 6:30 a.m. on MyYTV): Host Andrea Mahone will welcome Kadrian Hinton and Ely Ducatel from the Youngstown State University Inter-Varsity Christian Fellowship. 
“ A Conversation With Dee” (Sunday at 8:30 a.m. on WKBN-TV): Host Dee Crawford’s guest will be Carolyn Givens, executive director of Neil Kennedy Recovery Clinic. Givens will talk about the increase in drug and alcohol use in our community. 
“Senior Focus” (today and Sunday, and Oct. 31 and Nov. 1, at 9:30 a.m. on Armstrong Cable channels 20 and 100): Host Bill Adams will talk with Valley Legacy Award winners Kathy Fynes, Robert Marino and Harry Meshel about their community service and advocacy for local seniors. 
ENTERTAINMENT NEWS 
Toastmaster winner 
YOUNGSTOWN 
Youngstown Toastmasters club member Ed Haller will compete in the district contest today in Akron after winning the Humorous Speech competition at the Central Division contest on Oct. 15. 
Haller also came in second place in the Table Topics contest that evening. Other stories of interest
